thread.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic out to ‘conquer’ the aftershave world as Man United striker launches new fragrance
thread.title_full: Zlatan Ibrahimovic out to ‘conquer’ the aftershave world as Man United striker launches new fragrance

author: smorgan
title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic out to ‘conquer’ the aftershave world as Man United striker launches new fragrance
text:
What's Zlat smell? Zlatan Ibrahimovic out to ‘conquer’ the aftershave world as Man United striker launches new fragrance 
Red Devils striker releases sweet-smelling perfume for men and women and says 'My personality is in every drop' By Sam Morgan 30th March 2017, 2:17 pm Updated: 30th March 2017, 4:33 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ZLATAN IBRAHIMOVIC has laid out his plans to conquer the world all over again – after releasing his own brand of perfume. 
The Manchester United striker has done near enough all there is to do on the pitch. Manchester Evening News 3 Zlatan Ibrahimovic was delighted to launch his new perfume for men and women 
But he looks set on turning his attention to something else once his legendary career is finally over: Making everyone smell good. 
Ibrahimovic – who has confirmed he is in talks with United over a contract extension – looked pleased as punch to be in Cheshire at the release of his own aftershaves and fragrances. 
The one for women is called Supreme and the one for men is named, uh, Zlatan. 
At least it’s easy to remember. Reuters Zlatan Ibrahimovic has signalled his intention to stay at United for another year Manchester Evening News Zlatan Ibrahimovic was on show at the release of his fragrances Tyrone Mings stamps on Zlatan Ibrahimovic who then Elbows him in revenge Most read in football YOU WHAT? Bastian Schweinsteiger unveiled by Chicago Fire... and journalist asks him if his new MLS side can now win the World Cup CHELSEA CIVIL WAR Romelu Lukaku top of director of football Michael Emenalo's list to replace Diego Costa but boss Antonio Conte wants Alvaro Morata In Safe Hands Manchester United ready to make David De Gea one of their top earners to keep Real Madrid at bay Sticking point Everton coach leaves the club just days after his wonderkid son rejected the Toffees for Manchester United WIDE OF THE MARC Chelsea set to lose £70million fight with Barcelona for PSG's Italy midfield star Marco Verratti Luk Here Chelsea top brass want Romelu Lukaku back to prove to old boss Jose Mourinho that he was wrong to sell him, David Luiz and Kevin de Bruyne BLACK CAT-AMARAN SAVIOUR Sunderland hero Duncan Watmore left shaken after saving three lives in Barbados boat crash What a mistake Team of stars Manchester United booted out too soon including England new boy Michael Keane taking the cris Bizarre new bust of Cristiano Ronaldo sparks brilliant memes including Bowser and Sloth from the Goonies No Joshing Manchester United open talks with Bayern Munich over deal for Joshua Kimmich – but City want him too tangled webb Leyton Orient manager Danny Webb to resign from crisis club after bust-up with Francesco Becchetti 'EVEN JESUS DIDN'T PLEASE EVERYONE' Cristiano Ronaldo sculptor defends widely-mocked statue... and insists CR7 likes it SECRETS and lies Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm he's staying as Arsenal manager despite admitting he HAS made a decision... as he takes cheeky dig at Chelsea over Alexis Sanchez bid hollywood cole Former England star Ashley Cole goes out for dinner with girlfriend Sharon Canu just days after his ex Cheryl has a baby Settle the Bil Chelsea agree £500k fee for wonderkid Billy Gilmour - but Rangers haven't given up hope of keeping him CHELSEA? Alexis Sanchez casts doubts over Arsenal future after saying he wants to stay in London and play for winning team Yes way Jose Jose Mourinho is eyeing up a potential move for Atletico Madrid centre-back Jose Gimenez 'He is absurd' Jose Mourinho compares Manchester United's attempts to buy Neymar as like trying to crack open a vault Handy Andy Gladbach confirm Andreas Christensen WILL return to Chelsea after ace impressed Antonio Conte CUT AND DRIES Manchester United to offer £30m Dries Mertens £4.3m salary in bid to poach him from Napoli 
Ibrahimovic said: "I want to do something and conquer, just like I do with football. 
"I have been very involved from the start, I'm learning every day. 
"A couple of years ago, this was a whole new world for me, but I met two lovely persons who were very confident, just like me when I'm playing." 
And in case you were unsure about buying a bottle, Ibra had this final bit to say. 
He added: "I would never do something that I don't stand behind, it's not to make money. I will still eat. I will still survive. 
"It's a real challenge for me. My personality is in every drop."
